description: '''Preaching chords''' are [[blues]]/[[Black Gospel music|gospel]]-inspired chords played on a [[Hammond organ]] or [[piano]], and many times with a [[Drum kit|drum set]] as well, near the end of a pastor or minister's sermon to accentuate, emphasize, and respond to them in a musical way. Like the related tradition of sermonic [[Black sermonic tradition|"whooping"]] (pronounced like "''hooping''"), these chords are most often used in the [[Black church|Black Church]] and [[Pentecostalism|Pentecostal]] traditions.
